intro: Antherostylis calcarata, commonly known as the sandhill grass, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, grass-like appearance. The plant typically grows in sandy or coastal areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Its inflorescence consists of a dense cluster of spikelets, which produce small, wind-pollinated flowers. Antherostylis calcarata is often found in coastal dunes and salt marshes, where it plays a role in stabilizing sandy soils.
